result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah E Lustig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence. Release for work, inmate work assignments, the Day Reporting Center.  Credit for one day/2-11-15. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surchrge. To be paid during the course of probation to the probation agent.  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Seek/maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictins:  firearm possession and voting.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid presription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
No contact with Dorris S. dob 11/6/1955; or Chad R.  dob 4/28/1978.
For the reasons placed on  the record, the Court grants the defense request for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Notify DOC agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any doctor.
Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by DOC agent.  Notify the DOC agent of the pharmacy used.
Fine set at zero.
Particpate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfullycomplete recomended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah E Lustig

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED-
Court ordered defendant to serve 170 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for work, inmate work assignments, The Day Reporting Center; credit for 1 day (2-11-2015). Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for  18 MONTHS  with the following conditions:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
 - No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Seek/ Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
- No contact with Dorris S.(DOB 11-06-1955).
- No contact with Chad R. (DOB 04-28-1978).
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

For the reasons placed on the record, the Court GRANTS the Defense request for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED - 
The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Sarah E Lustig in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
State files an AMENDED INFORMATION as to Count 1:  the court amended the charge to Possession of Narcotic Drugs, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 961.41(3g)(am) , a class I FELONY.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated June 30, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Sarah E Lustig in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.   Case in court due to violation: Positive Drug Test.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for projected plea and sentencing on 07-01-2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 17.

ADDRESS INFO for Sarah E Lustig
Current: 1612 S 77th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53214   (Effective: 05-29-2015)
Prior: 1738 South 3rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Court orders defendant released to JUSTICE Point for Intensive Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia. Defendant to notify Justice Point of all prescriptions within 72 hours of receiving prescription from any Doctor. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court.  Signature bond increase to a total of $750.00. Defendant is to report immediately after court to Justice Point.

Defendant Sarah E Lustig in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Defense request an adjournment. Court grants adjournment for final time.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Increase Bail, with attached cover letter received and filed. tk

Defendant Sarah E Lustig in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  Defense counsel received discovery.  Court orders case for adjourned projected Plea and Sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sarah E Lustig in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case scheduled for Scheduling Conference. 
Court addresses the reassignment from Br. 3 to Br. 17. Court clarifies the case is not transferred to Br. 17 based upon a substitution of Judge, but transferred based on other assignment factors. Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Case adjourned for Status of Counsel on 4-23-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Status conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sarah E Lustig in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Dennis Murphy for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sarah E Lustig in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/16/15 @ 1:30 pm
